metadata.description: Relevance criteria for evaluating literature against theoretical framework and research direction

primary_research_focus.title: Agent Communication Protocol (ACP) and Agent-to-Agent Protocol (A2A) for Decentralized DER Predictive Maintenance Coordination
primary_research_focus.core_question: How can ACP and A2A be applied to enable secure, scalable, and interoperable communication for decentralized predictive maintenance coordination among diverse, multi-owner DERs?
primary_research_focus.subfocus: Designing conceptual framework and specifying core messaging patterns for decentralized DER health data exchange and predictive maintenance task initiation

1_core_concepts.description: Coverage of theoretical framework core concepts

der_systems.description: Papers addressing DER systems, characteristics, or applications

predictive_maintenance.description: Papers addressing predictive maintenance approaches, especially in energy systems

agent_protocols.description: Papers addressing agent communication protocols, standards, or implementations

decentralized_coordination.description: Papers addressing decentralized or distributed coordination mechanisms

communication_frameworks.description: Papers addressing communication frameworks and protocols

2_application_domain.description: Relevance to energy systems and maintenance domains

energy_systems.description: Papers focused on energy systems applications

industrial_automation.description: Papers addressing industrial automation relevant to energy systems

maintenance_operations.description: Papers addressing maintenance operations and coordination

3_technical_requirements.description: Coverage of key technical requirements from research scope

security.description: Papers addressing security aspects of communication or systems

scalability.description: Papers addressing scalability or performance characteristics

real_time.description: Papers addressing real-time or time-sensitive requirements

4_methodology_alignment.description: Alignment with research methodology and evaluation approaches

framework_design.description: Papers presenting framework design or architectural approaches

protocol_evaluation.description: Papers addressing protocol or system evaluation methodologies

case_studies.description: Papers presenting case studies or implementations

literature_reviews.description: Comprehensive review papers providing domain overview

5_innovation_potential.description: Papers presenting novel approaches or identifying research gaps

novel_approaches.description: Papers presenting novel or innovative approaches

research_gaps.description: Papers identifying research gaps or future directions

emerging_technologies.description: Papers addressing emerging technologies or future trends

out_of_scope: Papers focused solely on general AI without agent protocols
Papers on energy systems without communication/coordination aspects
Papers on maintenance without predictive or automated aspects
Papers on protocols without agent-based or energy domain applications
Papers focused on hardware design without communication protocols
Papers on pure economic/policy analysis without technical content
Papers on human factors without technical system integration
Papers on theoretical computer science without practical applications
methodology_mismatch: Papers requiring extensive empirical data collection
Papers focused on mathematical proofs without applications
Papers requiring extensive human subject research

inclusion_thresholds.description: Papers must achieve minimum 0.3 weighted score across all dimensions
inclusion_thresholds.description_core: Papers must score at least 0.2 in core concepts dimension

keyword_matching.method: Text analysis of title, abstract, and keywords

manual_assessment.criteria: Relevance to research questions and framework validation needs

scoring_methodology.final_score: Weighted sum across all dimensions, normalized to 0-1 scale
